Monkee-Boy

We are a boutique web service firm focused on user experience, design, development, inbound marketing, measurement, and maintenance.

Founded in 1998 by Aaron Bramwell, Monkee-Boy has evolved from a small, two-person web design and development shop to a full-service web, mobile, and marketing team based in one of the greatest cities in the world: Austin, TX. For 16 years we've been helping clients achieve their goals on the web by finding custom solutions that do two things: solve your unique problem and deliver tangible results. Don't forget to checkout our site at monkee-boy.com for more about us and our work.

The Position

We’re looking for a Creative Director to join the Monkee-Boy team.

Monkee-Boy’s Creative Director serves as the principal creative lead for the company and manages a small team of designers across multiple accounts. The Creative Director is responsible for directing all phases of creative work from concept development through production, for inspiring and motivating creative teams, and is accountable for maintaining a high quality of work at all times. This is a full time position and will be required to work from the Monkee-Boy World Headquarters in beautiful Austin, Texas.

The candidate will be competitively compensated based on work experience, demonstration of success, and other intangibles they bring to the table. They will be able to participate in all employee incentive programs.

The Requirements

We need a fearless leader with a passion for the web.

  • Strong communication skills and a clear ability to articulate design and interaction decisions to your team and the client.
  • Ability to provide clear and constructive feedback to design team to help maintain a high quality of work. Monkee-Boy is a tight-knit team, so we expect both the ability to lead and to learn from both the team and the industry.
  • Ability to work closely with new business development efforts, leading creative teams, developing client response materials and joining the Digital Producer, Technical Lead, and Content Strategist in client meetings to shape the project vision.
  • Holistic experience of the creative development process: from finding the right problems to solve, shaping an initial idea, creating or providing creative direction, to quality assurance of the developed product.
  • Experience with staff reviews, providing career path direction and guidance for designers.
  • User centered design approach with strong devotion to the end user and ability to sell it to the client.
  • Ability to balance project work and departmental management.
  • Passion for cultivating an environment where good work thrives.
  • Interest in innovation, refining internal processes, and constantly bettering both the department and the company.
  • Proven track record of producing work cost effectively and on schedule.
  • 5+ years of successful interactive design experience with a leadership role in an agency setting.

The Extras

Each of the below will get you a +1 with us.

  • Experience with Usability testing or implementing UX processes in an agency setting
  • Knowledge of web accessibility best practices and standards
  • Basic front-end knowledge (HTML, CSS) and experience with Content Management Systems.
  • A solid understanding of Information Architecture (IA) and Content Strategy, especially for complex web projects.
  • Experience facilitating design workshops, brainstorming sessions, or collaboration exercises with clients or internally
  • Active participation and contribution to the web community
  • Experience with Sketch or Invision
  • A strong passion for learning new technologies and collaborating with a team

The Design Team

This application process is not a one way street. It’s important not only for you to be a good fit for us but that we are a good fit for you. We won’t take it personally if you pass on us.

  • If you’ve browsed The Troop page you might have seen that our design team is pretty tight-knit. You’ll be managing a team of three UI/UX Designers and coordinating closely with other departments.
  • We’re split between Mac and PC: those of us on Macs primarily use Sketch + Photoshop and those of us on PC use Illustrator + Photoshop. You’ll have the freedom to pick whichever setup you prefer.
  • We love InVision, and think you will too (if you don’t already!)
  • We’re big on sharing ideas and social bookmarking, whether it’s a new button animation we saw or a cool illustration on Dribbble.
  • We’re pretty active in the design community, and believe in giving back where we can. We ♥ hackathons, meetups, and panel discussions outside of work hours.
  • We love to collaborate. Whether it’s in the office throwing around new ideas, asking each other for help, or meeting up at a nearby coffee shop for a little change of scenery.
